result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmond David Haramis

defendant.name: Haramis, Desmond David
defendant.address: 3803 South Brook Place, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Desmond David Haramis in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Desmond David Haramis.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmond David Haramis appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Desmond David Haramis.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State. Court sets matter for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Desmond David Haramis appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Desmond David Haramis.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmond David Haramis in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.   Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-21-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RAS.

Defendant Desmond David Haramis in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-17-2022 @2:30p
